title: Configure Claude agent permissions for queries
description:
When bot.py spawns `claude -p` for queries, it needs pre-approved permissions to read the database. Currently no permission handling.

Options:
1. CLI flag: `--allowedTools "Bash(sqlite3*),Read,Write(/tmp/*)"`
2. Settings file: Configure ~/.claude/settings.json with allowlist
3. MCP server: Create dedicated read-only database query tool

Trade-offs:
- Option 1: Simple, explicit per-invocation, but hardcoded in bot.py
- Option 3: System-wide, cleaner bot.py, but requires Pi configuration
- Option 4: Cleanest/safest, but more code to write and maintain
close_reason: Added --allowedTools flag with Bash(sqlite3*), Bash(python*), Write(/tmp/*) to pre-approve permissions for database queries and chart generation.
